result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donovan D Paffel in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Donovan D Paffel in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF301, 15CM161 and 15CM162

State relates agreement. Victim rights statements filed. C-31 filed. Felony admonitions given. 

15CF301 - Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
Court orders counts 2 and 3 be dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders 15CM161 and 15CM162 be dismissed and read in. 
Parties request the court waive the PSI. Court accepts the waiver. 

S.W. gives victim statement. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 

Court relates and orders: 
SW- 3 years probation
120 days jail with Huber. 45 days credit to be applied to the conditional jail sentence. 
$12050.00 restitution per C-31
Must maintain full time employment or schooling. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  
AODA and cognitive thinking and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.

JAIL FAXED

(Clerked by RWinger)
Defendant Donovan D Paffel in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Donovan D Paffel in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF301, 15CM161 and 15CM162
15CF301 - Not guilty pleas entered. 
All cases reset to 8/17/15 at 3:00 PM.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Donovan D Paffel in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Donovan D Paffel in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 15CM161 AND 15CM162.
Attorney O'Hara relates that defendant has new case and is in custody on cash bail that he is not able to post.  
State moves to revoke diversion court agreements.  Court revokes agreements.
Both cases continued to 08-10-2015 with Judge Bitney to be heard on same day as new case.
  Plea hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Donovan D Paffel in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM161 and 15CM162
Diversion court agreement filed. 
Copy given to Defendant and DA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: COVERS 15CM161,15CM162 - Attorney Fees - $75.00 per month by wage assignment beginning 06-01-2015 - Laura Sutton

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant Donovan D Paffel in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM161 and 15CM162
Blue form filed. Defendant sworn. Court appoints attorney Laura Sutton and orders repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month to begin 6/1/15. 
Not guilty plea entered. Formal reading waived.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
